info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 13 at 3:53PM PDT by NWS Reno
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will north Reno near Sun Valley through 415 PM PDT... At 352 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Golden Valley, or near Reno, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. Torrential rain with ponding of water on roadways. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Reno, Sparks, Wingfield Springs, Lemmon Valley-Golden Valley, Spanish Springs, Nws Reno and Sun Valley. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
